pytealutils.strings package

Submodules

pytealutils.strings.string module

pytealutils.strings.string.ascii_to_int(arg: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

ascii_to_int converts the integer representing a character in ascii to the actual integer it represents

pytealutils.strings.string.atoi(a: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

atoi converts a byte string representing a number to the integer value it represents

pytealutils.strings.string.encode_uvarint(val: <TealType.uint64: 0>, b: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

Returns the uvarint encoding of an integer

Useful in the case that the bytecode for a contract is being populated, since integers in a contract are uvarint encoded

This subroutine is recursive, the first call should include the integer to be encoded and an empty bytestring

pytealutils.strings.string.head(s: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

head gets the first byte from a bytestring, returns as bytes

pytealutils.strings.string.int_to_ascii(arg: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

int_to_ascii converts an integer to the ascii byte that represents it

pytealutils.strings.string.itoa(i: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

itoa converts an integer to the ascii byte string it represents

pytealutils.strings.string.prefix(s: <TealType.bytes: 1>, n: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

prefix returns the first n bytes of a given byte string

pytealutils.strings.string.rest(s: <TealType.bytes: 1>, n: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

prefix returns the first n bytes of a given byte string

pytealutils.strings.string.suffix(s: <TealType.bytes: 1>, n: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

suffix returns the last n bytes of a given byte string

pytealutils.strings.string.tail(s: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

tail returns the string with the first character removed

pytealutils.strings.string.witoa(i: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

witoa converts an byte string interpreted as an integer to the ascii byte string it represents
